sub_title: Professor e/mHealth applications at Open university of the Netherlands
summary:
Catherine Bolman is professor in eHealth-applications at the Open University of the Netherlands (health psychology field). Her work and publications concentrate on determinants of health-related behaviours, behavioral change strategies and the development, evaluation and dissemination of eHealth interventions (including mobile applications).

In her professorship she focusses on strategies to improve the reach and use of eHealth interventions, especially in those who are most vulnerable to health problems. This encompasses for example dissemination and user engagement strategies, testing innovative practical applications (new advancing technologies such as  virtual and augmented reality, tracking systems,  gaming, social media). Catherine supervises PhD projects on eHealth applications.

Publications: https://research.ou.nl/en/persons/catharina-bolman-2/publications/

projects.title: Kanker Nazorg Wijzer (Cancer Aftercare Guide)
projects.description:
We developed an easily accessible, E-health intervention, the ‘Kanker Nazorg Wijzer’ (Cancer Aftercare Guide; KNW) for cancer survivors to facilitate and support self-management skills. The KNW is based on computer tailoring and can reach broad patient populations at low costs, while still providing specific information tailored to the personal needs of the user.The KNW is consistent with the current guidelines, stating that selfmanagement in cancer survivors should be stimulated.
To evaluate the KNW, a RCT is currently conducted with follow-up measurements at 3, 6 and 12 months comparing the KNW intervention to a waiting list control group.

projects.title: Kanker Nazorg Wijzer
projects.description: De Kanker Nazorg Wijzer is een e-health interventie voor mensen die kanker hebben gehad. Gebruikers ontvangen advies op maat in de vorm van informatie, oefeningen en filmpjes. Doel is het bevorderen van zelfmanagement vaardigheden en de kwaliteit van leven.
